sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Insider Spends US$571k Buying More Shares In Butterfly Network
feed.summary: An independent director at Butterfly Network (NYSE:BFLY) recently purchased US$571k worth of stock, significantly increasing their holding and demonstrating confidence in the company. While insider selling occurred throughout the year, this recent large purchase, coupled with a 17% insider ownership, suggests alignment between insiders and shareholders and overall optimism for the company's future.

feed.title: Butterfly Network (BFLY) director Robbins buys $64k in shares By Investing.com
feed.summary: Butterfly Network (BFLY) director Larry Robbins recently purchased 21,370 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $64,471, and has indirectly substantial holdings through Glenview Investment Funds and Longview Investors LLC. The company maintains a "GOOD" financial health rating with robust liquidity despite not being profitable in the last year, and has seen a 40% price return over the past six months. Recent company developments include exceeding Q3 revenue expectations, signing a co-development deal with Midjourney, Inc. for its semiconductor-based ultrasound technology, and launching the Compass AI enterprise software platform.

feed.title: Butterfly Network (BFLY) director Robbins buys $64k in shares By Investing.com
feed.summary: Butterfly Network (BFLY) director Larry Robbins purchased 21,370 shares for $64,471 on December 11, 2025, with prices ranging from $3.015 to $3.02. This transaction saw a potential 6.4% gain as BFLY shares rose to $3.21. The medical imaging company, with a market capitalization of approximately $807 million, maintains a strong financial position despite not being profitable over the last year, and its stock has shown strong momentum with a 40% price return over the past six months.

feed.title: Butterfly Network (BFLY) director Robbins buys $64k in shares

The medical imaging company maintains a strong financial position with more cash than debt and a current ratio of 4.8.

feed.title: Butterfly Network (BFLY) director Robbins buys $64k in shares
feed.summary: Larry Robbins, a director at Butterfly Network (NASDAQ:BFLY), purchased 21,370 shares of Class A Common Stock for $64,471 on December 11, 2025. This transaction increased his direct ownership to 365,505 shares, including unvested units, complementing his substantial indirect holdings. The purchase comes after Butterfly Network reported mixed Q3 2025 earnings and advanced its technology with a Midjourney co-development deal and the launch of Compass AI.

feed.title: Jonathan Rothberg sells Butterfly Network (BFLY) stock worth $3.06m
feed.summary: Jonathan Rothberg, a ten percent owner and Director of Butterfly Network (NASDAQ:BFLY), sold nearly 1 million Class A Common Stock shares across two days in December 2025, totaling $3.06 million. These sales, executed under a pre-arranged trading plan for estate planning, occurred at prices slightly above the current stock value. Butterfly Network, with a market cap of $779.28 million, demonstrates strong financial health but analysts do not anticipate profitability this year.

feed.title: Rothberg of Butterfly Network sells $1.88 million in BFLY stock

(NASDAQ:BFLY), sold 605,565 shares of Class A Common Stock worth $1.88 million between December 10 and December 12, 2025. Following these sales, Rothberg directly holds 2,880,252 shares of Class A Common Stock and indirectly holds additional shares through various LLCs.

Robbins now directly and indirectly holds a significant number of Butterfly Network shares, including 365,505 directly owned and indirectly through investment funds.

(NASDAQ:BFLY), sold over 2.1 million shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $7 million between November 24 and November 26, 2025, executed under a 10b5-1 trading plan. This insider sale comes amidst the company's recent mixed third-quarter earnings, a licensing agreement with Midjourney, and the launch of its new Compass AI software platform.

feed.title: Butterfly Network (BFLY) director Robbins buys $6.7m in shares

(NASDAQ:BFLY) has invested $6.78 million in the company's Class A Common Stock, purchasing 2.8 million shares across three transactions. These purchases, made between November 19 and November 21, 2025, come as the stock has shown significant volatility and a 25% return over the past week. The insider buying follows Butterfly Network's Q3 2025 earnings report, which indicated revenue exceeding expectations but an EPS miss, alongside a new co-development and licensing agreement with Midjourney, Inc. and the launch of its Compass AI platform.

feed.title: Butterfly Network (BFLY) director Robbins buys $6.7m in shares By Investing.com

These purchases occurred between November 19 and November 21, 2025, at prices ranging from $2.3539 to $2.5802 per share. Following these acquisitions, Robbins now directly and indirectly owns over 12.7 million shares, coinciding with a 25% return for BFLY over the past week and recent mixed financial results and a new co-development agreement with Midjourney, Inc.

feed.title: Butterfly Network Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Butterfly Network, Inc. reported third quarter 2025 financial results, with total revenue of $21.5 million, marking 5% year-over-year growth, and a reduction in quarterly cash burn to $3.9 million. The company reaffirmed its full-year revenue guidance and narrowed its adjusted EBITDA guidance, highlighting foundational progress and advancing AI, strengthening enterprise readiness, and pushing forward on technology milestones. Key operational and strategic highlights include new clinical validation, global security accreditations, and advancements in AI-powered tools and chip development.

feed.title: Medical University of South Carolina joins forces with Butterfly Network to transform patient care, health education and medical research
feed.summary: The Medical University of South Carolina (MUSC) has partnered with Butterfly Network (NYSE: BFLY) to integrate Butterfly Blueprint™, an AI-powered handheld ultrasound platform, into its healthcare system. This collaboration aims to revolutionize patient care, health education, and medical research by providing clinicians, students, and researchers with accessible point-of-care ultrasound technology. The initiative will initially focus on rural and underserved areas within South Carolina, incorporating training into medical curricula and exploring new models of care delivery.

feed.title: Butterfly Network, Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
feed.summary: Butterfly Network, Inc. released its Q3 2025 Form 10-Q report, detailing a total revenue of $21.5 million, a 4.5% increase year-over-year, despite a net loss of $34.0 million primarily due to an inventory charge. The company saw growth in product revenue driven by international sales and increased units fulfilled, particularly with the launch of the iQ3 probe. Future plans include investing in revenue growth, focusing on healthcare system software, and shifting towards software and services in its revenue mix.

feed.title: Butterfly Network Announces Pricing of $75.6 million Public Offering of Common Stock
feed.summary: Butterfly Network, Inc. announced the pricing of an underwritten public offering of 24,000,000 shares of its Class A common stock at $3.15 per share, expecting to raise approximately $75.6 million. The company plans to use the net proceeds to fund the development and commercialization of new and existing products and services, as well as for general corporate purposes. The offering is expected to close on January 31, 2025, with TD Cowen, William Blair, and Lake Street Capital Markets acting as bookrunners.

feed.title: Butterfly Network Flying High, Wait For The Price To Flutter Down (NYSE:BFLY)
feed.summary: Despite recent stock momentum, Butterfly Network (BFLY) is considered a "sell" at its current price of $4.90 due to unprofitability and significant market risks including tariffs and competition. The company's valuation metrics are weak, with low earnings growth and a concerning decrease in R&D spending, raising questions about future innovation. Additionally, BFLY is issuing more stock for the second time in six years, further impacting its financial outlook.

feed.title: CORRECTING and REPLACING Butterfly Network Reports Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Butterfly Network reported its second-quarter 2025 financial results, achieving its highest quarterly revenue of $23.4 million and record gross margins of 64%. The company also reduced its quarterly cash usage to $7.1 million and revised its full-year revenue guidance while improving Adjusted EBITDA guidance. These results highlight the company's progress in scaling its core business and leveraging its technology for new revenue streams.

feed.title: Butterfly Network, Inc. Experiences Revision in Stock Evaluation Amid Market Dynamics - Markets Mojo
feed.summary: Butterfly Network, Inc. has seen significant stock fluctuations, with weekly and monthly returns outperforming the S&P 500, despite a year-to-date decline. Technical indicators present a mixed outlook, showing both bullish and bearish signals across different timeframes. The company's fluctuating market position highlights the need for ongoing performance monitoring.

feed.title: Butterfly Network (BFLY): Assessing Valuation After Breakthrough AI Ultrasound Launch in Africa
feed.summary: Butterfly Network (BFLY) has launched an AI-powered ultrasound tool in Malawi and Uganda, boosting its stock by 41.05% in one week and 40.31% over the year. While a "Fair Value" analysis suggests the stock is undervalued at $3.17, current multiples indicate significant valuation risks, with its sales ratio of 7.7 being much higher than the industry average of 2.7. The company's path to profitability could be challenged by ongoing operating losses and leadership changes.

feed.title: Butterfly Network (NYSE:BFLY) Shares Gap Up - Should You Buy?
feed.summary: Butterfly Network (NYSE:BFLY) shares gapped up to $2.48 following a previous close of $2.33, with analysts holding a "Hold" consensus rating and a target price of $3.00. The company reported revenue of $23.38 million last quarter and beat EPS expectations, despite having negative financial metrics. Insider trading activity shows recent sales by an insider, while institutional investors have adjusted their stakes in the company.

feed.title: CORRECTING and REPLACING Butterfly Network Reports Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Butterfly Network reported its second quarter 2025 financial results, achieving its highest quarterly revenue of $23.4 million and gross margins of 64%. The company also reduced quarterly cash used to $7.1 million and revised its full-year revenue guidance while improving Adjusted EBITDA guidance. Additionally, Heather Getz, Chief Financial and Operations Officer, resigned, with Megan Carlson stepping in as interim CFO.

feed.title: With A 28% Price Drop For Butterfly Network, Inc. (NYSE:BFLY) You'll Still Get What You Pay For
feed.summary: Butterfly Network, Inc. (NYSE:BFLY) has experienced a 28% share price drop in the last month, yet its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 5.4x remains higher than most of its peers in the Medical Equipment industry. This high P/S ratio is largely driven by its strong revenue growth, with a 26% increase in the last year and a projected 21% climb for the coming year, significantly outpacing the industry forecast. The company's superior revenue outlook suggests that shareholders are confident in its future prospects, keeping the share price buoyant despite the recent drop.

feed.title: Butterfly Network (NYSE:BFLY) Is In A Strong Position To Grow Its Business
feed.summary: Butterfly Network (NYSE:BFLY) has shown strong share price growth despite being unprofitable, with its stock up 146% in the last year. The company appears to be in a good financial position with a 4.5-year cash runway, reduced cash burn by 58%, and revenue growth of 26%. Analysts believe the company can easily raise additional capital if needed due to its low cash burn relative to market capitalization.

feed.title: Healthcare's Quiet AI Boom Is Creating a New Class of Breakout Contenders
feed.summary: The article discusses the growing impact of AI in healthcare, highlighting several companies making significant strides in the field. It emphasizes the financial growth projections for AI in healthcare and details how companies like Avant Technologies, Butterfly Network, AptarGroup/AstraZeneca, and Relay Therapeutics are leveraging AI for early disease detection, improved diagnostics, and accelerated drug discovery. The focus is on the transformative potential of AI for enhancing patient care and operational efficiency within the healthcare sector.

feed.title: Butterfly Network raising $76.5 million from public offering
feed.summary: Butterfly Network is expected to raise $76.6 million from a public offering of 24 million shares of its Class A common stock at $3.15 per share, with the offering closing today. The company plans to use the proceeds for product development, commercialization, and general corporate purposes, after reporting a 35% Q4 revenue growth expectation.

feed.title: Butterfly Network announces public stock offering
feed.summary: Butterfly Network, a company specializing in portable ultrasound technology, has announced a public offering of its Class A common stock, with proceeds earmarked for product development and general corporate purposes. The company boasts a strong liquidity position and recent positive analyst ratings, despite facing profitability challenges. This offering aims to capitalize on its technological advancements and strong demand for its products, including the award-winning iQ3.

feed.title: Butterfly Network Expands its Next-Generation Butterfly iQ3™ to Europe
feed.summary: Butterfly Network has launched its third-generation handheld point-of-care ultrasound system, Butterfly iQ3, in Europe, making it available in 16 countries. The device features unparalleled image quality, new advanced 3D capabilities like iQ Slice and iQ Fan, and an ergonomic design, building on its semiconductor-based Ultrasound-on-Chip™ technology. This expansion follows successful uptake in the US and Canada and aims to democratize ultrasound access for healthcare providers across Europe.

feed.title: ThinkSono Releases Real-Time DVT AI Training Solution for Butterfly Network’s Handheld Ultrasound Devices
feed.summary: ThinkSono has released its AI Training app for deep vein thrombosis (DVT) on the Butterfly Garden AI Marketplace, designed to work with Butterfly Network's handheld ultrasound devices. This solution leverages AI to enhance point-of-care ultrasound training for students and clinicians, ultimately improving DVT detection skills. The partnership aims to reduce barriers to ultrasound adoption by providing an accessible and integrated training platform for Butterfly Network's large user base.

feed.title: Medical imaging company describes future of at-home ultrasounds, wearables
feed.summary: Butterfly Network, a medical imaging company, recently received FDA clearance for its new semiconductor-based ultrasound technology, Butterfly iQ3. The company envisions a future where its products, including this third iteration of their technology, are regularly used in people's homes. This move highlights their strategy towards making medical imaging more accessible and integrated into daily life through at-home ultrasounds and wearables.

feed.title: Butterfly Network Launches Next-Generation Butterfly iQ3 in the United States
feed.summary: Butterfly Network has commercially launched its third-generation handheld point-of-care ultrasound (POCUS) system, Butterfly iQ3, in the United States. The iQ3 features advanced semiconductor technology, enhanced image quality, and new 3D imaging capabilities like iQ Slice and iQ Fan. With a smaller, lighter, and more ergonomic design, the iQ3 aims to set a new standard for ultrasound imaging, making it accessible to both experienced POCUS experts and new learners.

feed.title: Butterfly Announces CEO Transition
feed.summary: Butterfly Network, Inc. announced that Todd Fruchterman, M.D., Ph.D. will be stepping down from his position as President and Chief Executive Officer and as a member of the Board of Directors. Dr. Fruchterman will assist with a smooth transition through the end of the year. Jonathan Rothberg, Founder and Chairman of the Board, will serve as Interim CEO during the search for a permanent replacement.

feed.title: Butterfly Network Recognized As “Best New Ultrasound Solution” in 2022 MedTech Breakthrough Awards Program
feed.summary: Butterfly Network, a digital health company, has been awarded "Best New Ultrasound Solution" in the sixth annual MedTech Breakthrough Awards for its Butterfly iQ+ handheld, whole-body ultrasound transducer. The device, powered by Ultrasound-on-Chip technology, offers an affordable and portable solution for clinicians to perform advanced imaging. Butterfly iQ+ aims to make informed care decisions more accessible and accelerate diagnosis in various healthcare settings.

feed.title: Fujifilm files suit against rival ultrasound maker Butterfly Network claiming patent infringement
feed.summary: Fujifilm Sonosite Inc. has filed a lawsuit against Butterfly Network, alleging infringement on seven patents related to handheld, point-of-care ultrasound technology. Fujifilm claims the patents cover image processing, graphical interface elements, and probe usage with mobile devices, emphasizing its commitment to defending its intellectual property. Butterfly Network, while not commenting directly on pending litigation, highlighted its own extensive patent portfolio and preparedness to defend against the claims.

feed.title: Fujifilm Sonosite Files Patent Infringement Lawsuit Against Butterfly Network
feed.summary: Fujifilm Sonosite has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Butterfly Network in the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware. The lawsuit alleges infringement on seven patents related to fundamental technologies for acquiring ultrasound images with portable handheld systems, covering aspects from probe use with mobile devices to image processing and display. Fujifilm Sonosite is seeking damages for Butterfly Network's unauthorized use, manufacture, marketing, promotion, and sale of its IQ/IQ+ POCUS products, emphasizing the protection of its intellectual property rights and R&D investments.

feed.title: SHARHOLDER ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Reminds Shareholders with Losses on their Investment in Butterfly Network, Inc. f/k/a Longview Acquisition Corp., of Class Action Lawsuit and Upcoming Deadline - BFLY
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP has announced a class action lawsuit against Butterfly Network, Inc. (f/k/a Longview Acquisition Corp., NYSE: BFLY), reminding shareholders with losses of the upcoming deadline to apply for Lead Plaintiff status. The lawsuit alleges that Butterfly and its officers made materially false and misleading statements regarding the company's business and financial prospects, particularly concerning the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on its gross margin and revenue projections. Shareholders who purchased securities between February 16, 2021, and November 15, 2021, or held common stock as of the record date for the merger approval, have until April 18, 2022, to seek lead plaintiff appointment.

feed.title: Butterfly Network Advances Medical Imaging in Canada with Butterfly iQ+
feed.summary: Butterfly Network announced that its second-generation Butterfly iQ+ received Class III Medical Device License approval in Canada, making the advanced handheld ultrasound device available to Canadian healthcare providers. The iQ+ features Ultrasound-on-Chip™ technology with hardware and software advancements designed to improve usability and care delivery, including Biplane Imaging™, automatic bladder volume calculation, and Needle Viz™. This expansion into Canada signifies a significant opportunity for impact within the Canadian healthcare system, which consists of over 86,000 physicians and 830 hospitals.
